sanitised_text:
Person A: Hey. You better call me as soon as you get this. We need to talk.

Person B: What’s up?

Person A: I am not telling you what the issue is just so you can decide whether or not my problem is significant enough for you to be concerned about. I am not telling you. Forget it.

Person B: You just said there was a problem. I am getting ready for work. Is this an emergency?? Are you okay? What’s going on?

Person A: Oh, it’s nothing. But call me immediately. As soon as you get on the road.

Person B: What?? Is there a problem or isn’t there? Can’t you just say what the issue is? If it’s important, just say so.

Person A: You’re not really getting ready for work, are you? Why are you texting me if you are so busy?? You’re not busy. You’re just avoiding me! I don’t have to take your abuse. You make me feel like a piece of garbage, like nothing I have to say is important. You don’t care about me at all!

Person B: I just asked you what the issue is, but you won’t tell me! What am I supposed to do?

Person A: NOTHING! FORGET I ASKED! IT’S ALWAYS ALL ABOUT YOU AND WHAT YOU WANT. YOU COULD CARE LESS IF I WAS DYING!!!

Person B: Come ON! You know that’s not true. Talk to me.

Person A: I CAN’T TALK TO YOU! YOU NEVER LISTEN TO ANYTHING I SAY!

Person B: I am trying, but…

Person A: It’s been 30 minutes, and you still haven’t called. What is taking so long? I bet you are texting someone else. Probably one of your many admirers…I am surprised you have any time for anything else. Must feel great having all those people to talk to who stroke your ego any time you want. You know they only talk to you because they want to sleep with you, right? They are all the same, and you love it, just admit it. You love the attention. JUST SAY IT

Person B: I can’t deal with this craziness today. I have a big day ahead. Can you knock it off? If you’re still upset at lunch, let’s chat.

Person A: I must talk to you NOW, and your day is NOT going to dictate what I get from you. You WILL CALL or you will see a very different side of me real soon.

Person B: You mean a more fun side than this? Can’t wait.

Person A: THAT’S IT!! YOU HAVE PISSED ME OFF FOR THE LAST TIME! MARK MY WORDS YOU WILL BE SORRY. I HAVE A MEETING NOW. GO AWAY.

Person B: OK :/

Person A: OK?!?!?!? is that all you have to say? Just okay? God, what kind of horrible worthless piece of garbage must you think I am in order to treat me like this?

…..and on and on for an hour or more…

…and then later, after work:

Person A: Hey, let’s get a drink.

Person B: I don’t want to. No.

Person A: So you hate me now? Should I just not contact you ever again? Is that how it is? Tell me, so I won’t have to waste another minute of my life talking to you.

Person B: *sigh*

Oh, it’s nothing. But call me immediately. As soon as you get on the road.

You’re not really getting ready for work, are you? Why are you texting me if you are so busy?? You’re not busy. You’re just avoiding me! I don’t have to take your abuse. You make me feel like a piece of garbage, like nothing I have to say is important. You don’t care about me at all!

You mean a more fun side than this? Can’t wait.
THAT’S IT!! YOU HAVE PISSED ME OFF FOR THE LAST TIME! MARK MY WORDS YOU WILL BE SORRY. I HAVE A MEETING NOW. GO AWAY.
OK?!?!?!? is that all you have to say? Just okay? God, what kind of horrible worthless piece of garbage must you think I am in order to treat me like this?
So you hate me now? Should I just not contact you ever again? Is that how it is? Tell me, so I won’t have to waste another minute of my life talking to you.

unused_labels: Acting as if nothing remarkable happened
Convincing to give up something important
Making others more dependent on them
Making others question their own reality
Making another person dependent on speaker for information
Subverting the goals of the other person
Creating a constraint favorable to the speaker
Choosing a most comfortable environment for themselves to feel more powerful
Making other feel like they are doing something wrong
Not verifying the negative assumptions about the other person
Not asking for the other person's viewpoint on relevant matters
qualitative_evaluation:
Person A's conversational style is emotionally charged, confrontational, and manipulative. They frequently use guilt-tripping and emotional blackmail to try to control the conversation and Person B's responses. They also tend to jump to conclusions and make accusations without clear evidence. 

Person B, on the other hand, is more patient, calm, and rational. They try to understand the situation and ask for clarification, but also show signs of frustration and exhaustion due to Person A's behavior. They attempt to set boundaries and maintain their own needs, but are often met with more hostility from Person A.
